Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is very worn, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and very faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a text (list?) of uncertain character.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.129)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36335) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36335)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 156 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
